column4: I've been looking all over the forums for help on this, but found nothing useful... every time I try to install 5.10, it gets up to a dialog saying "setting up partitions..." then it goes to a blue screen with a grey line at the bottom and stays there. I left it on all night, nothing changed.
it doesn't get far enough for me to actually choose what partition I want to use
nope, checked the integrity of the cd
I've tried doing it a few different ways.. I have an ext3 partition preformatted that I was going to use, it didn't work that way
and I tried it with an unformatted partition, same situation
I had something similar that I worked around.  What happens exactly?  I didn't get the first part of what you were saying.
do you have SATA, or promise IDE?
, , can you disconnect the PCI/IDE just for the purpose of getting the install going?
it is, but I think in this case it is necessary
yes.  On my box, there is a problem in the BIOS that forks ubuntu up during install if the PCI/IDE is enabled
after the install I used the PCI/IDE
it is just that partitioning step that has the problem, at least on my box.
after the install, as long as the "detect off board IDE first" flag is not set, everything works.
in fact, I think the problem is that detect offboard first is set in the install kernel.
